name: Atum Works
one_liner: Gigascale Nanomanufacturing
long_description:
Atum Works is building 3D ASML.

The world is hooked on chips, thanks to the power of lithography.
But, 2D lithography resolution has maxed out: Moore's law is dead.
To move forward, we must transition to a 3D manufacturing process whose cost scales with materials, not layers. 

Atum Works is building the world's most advanced 3D lithography process to 3D print parts >10,000x cheaper in low-volume and 10x cheaper in mass-manufacturing compared to today's 2D lithography. 

Since starting YC, we have built a printer, and partnered with NVIDIA. 
We are shipping products this year. 

Founded by Caltech and NASA engineers, we're starting the next scaling law of semiconductor manufacturing, this time in 3D.

launches.title: Atum Works: The Next Dimension of Compute
launches.body:
**TL;DR**\
Atum Works is 3D printing the 3D devices of the future for 1/10th the cost of today’s 2D lithography.\
\
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0n0Di5sLCjo&feature=youtu.be>\
\
**Problem**

“For the past 50 years, semiconductor-technology development has felt like walking inside a tunnel. The road ahead was clear, as there was a well-defined path. And everyone knew what needed to be done: shrink the transistor. Now, we have reached the end of the tunnel."\
H.-S. Philip Wong, Chief Scientist, TSMC, 2024.

Today’s 2D lithography has hit a fundamental wall in feature density, so the semiconductor industry has begun stacking 2D layers to fit more transistors, bits, and bandwidth on each chip. \
\
But stacking scales cost exponentially with density, unlike the constant cost days of Moore: a 10-layer high bandwidth memory (HBM) package is \~5x more expensive than the same amount of un-stacked DRAM.

**Solution**

Using a 3D process to make today's increasingly 3D integrated circuits could shortcut this problem, scaling process complexity with materials rather than layers and enabling the next decade of continued progress.

Our 3D lithography technology can do this: it is capable of fabricating multi-material 3D structures with 100 nm resolution at wafer scale.

Where the ability to create more complex forms enables more complex functions, such granular control of matter enables the future of much more than just chips, including biotech, sensing, and advanced materials.

We recently crossed the cost thresholds that make this technology commercially viable. We are currently in conversation with customers, and will be driving an exponential scaling law in the production capacity of this technology over the coming decade.\
\
**What we’ve achieved so far**

* Set up our manufacturing facility and lab in Mountain View, CA.
* Built our first 3D nano-printer.
* Acquired our first customers, including an LOI for co-development with NVIDIA.

**What’s next**

* Sell our first products (this year).
* Exponentially scale production volume.
* SECRET.

**Team**

![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXcMsUlRx_bo7xJvNWmZaC-39OI7Hknw0Y65Er2tjyUh54Sd4--EgCih-wQzZojhTUdUgn2OqKfPxVzmnfqnJGprg2qacYS56K-eYqnSh_n3uz75XB9uyCslMaxReWdNHhKkcVHF?key=cch75ExUod4AOIuWU2xY6A)

We’re a team of physicists and systems engineers from Caltech and NASA, where we previously matured multiple nascent technologies, winning NASA’s Most Visionary Concept and Best Product Development awards.\
\
**Advisory Board**\
Dr. H.-S. Philip Wong: Chief Scientist, TSMC \
Dr. Eli Yablonovitch: Director Emeritus of the NSF Center for Energy Efficient Electronics Science (E3S)\
Dr. Julia Greer: Director, Caltech Kavli Nanoscience Institute   \
Dr. Michael Hochberg: Silicon Photonics Pioneer \
Dr. Pooya Tadayon: Intel Fellow 

**Asks**\
Join our team! If you are, or know any world-class applied physicists, material scientists, chemists, systems engineers, please get in touch!\
\
Become our customer! If you or someone you know needs something unfathomably complex fabricated with a 100 nm minimum feature size, please get in touch!

launches.title: Willow Voice - Voice is Your New Keyboard
launches.body:
Hey everyone! We're Allan and Lawrence, and we're building Willow.

**TLDR**: Willow is an AI dictation app that writes anywhere on your computer. Designed for those who rely on email, messaging, and AI prompting workflows to work 4x faster.

→ [Try it for free on Mac.](https://WillowVoice.com)

You can get set up in minutes and start dictating right away.

Launch video: https://youtu.be/8q9FRS8Km5U

### **Why we’re building Willow Voice**

We spent an entire year pivoting across different industries before landing on Willow.

We started out building for assisted living facilities. The product didn’t land, but we discovered that dictation was a tool to help them stay connected and independent. That showed us how powerful voice could be.

Then, we pivoted to building for medical clinics. We saw how AI scribes were saving doctors hours on documentation and letting them focus on patient care.

Through all these pivots, one thing became clear. Voice dictation is a superpower for anyone who types a lot. It’s 4x faster and easier than manual typing. 

Why isn’t voice the default way we interact with our computers? Because the technology just wasn’t there—until now.

That insight led us to build Willow: fast, precise, and personalized voice dictation designed for how we work today.

### **The solution: Willow Voice**

What makes Willow special is that it’s not just basic voice typing. It’s smart, fast, and sounds like _you_. Here’s how:

* **Context-awareness**: Willow looks at what you’re working on so it can get technical terms, names, and phrases right.
* **Custom dictionaries**: You can add your own words—like company names, industry terms, or team slang—so they’re always spelled correctly.
* **Smart correction and formatting**: Willow automatically fixes mistakes and adds structure—like formatting emails, breaking up paragraphs, and handling punctuation.
* **Personalization** _(beta)_: We’re working on making Willow sound just like you—adjusting tone and style depending on what you’re writing.
* **Privacy**: Willow runs in the cloud for speed and accuracy, but we never store or collect your voice or data. Privacy is our top priority, and it’s built into everything we do. There’s an optional, opt-in setting for users who want to help improve the model, completely anonymized.

It’s 40%+ more accurate than built-in dictation tools, works in under a second, and is so good that most users replace nearly all their typing with it.

### **Who’s using Willow**

People with heavy typing workflows love Willow because it helps them move faster and get more done. This includes: 

* **Engineers at YC** companies use Willow to prompt AI tools like Cursor up to 4x faster.
* **Managers at Github, Canva, and Webflow** rely on it to brainstorm, take notes, and write docs hands-free.
* **Sales teams** use Willow to reply instantly on Slack, email, and CRM tools.
* **Busy professionals** drowning in email use Willow to clear out their inbox in minutes, not hours.

### **Our ASK**

**Try Willow Voice** → [WillowVoice.com](http://WillowVoice.com)

It helps you get work done 4x faster, just by talking rather than typing.

It’s free to start and works instantly on Mac. We’d love to hear what you think!

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90217&key=user_uploads/1946827/bc11a0ad-17c4-4f8e-b7e8-339fa9fea0bb)

name: Tropir
one_liner: Traceback why your AI failed
long_description:
Tropir helps AI teams debug failures in complex LLM pipelines by tracing where things broke—a prompt drift, tool error, or bad retrieval. While other platforms log inputs and outputs, Tropir traces the information flow through chained LLM calls, connecting the dots from symptoms to root cause.

We're already used by teams building advanced agents, copilots, and RAG pipelines. As LLM-based systems grow, we believe Tropir will become essential infrastructure for every serious AI team.

launches.title: Partcl: Design Chips in minutes
launches.body:
Imagine hitting _compile_ and waiting **3 weeks** to learn you missed a semicolon... or **5 weeks** to catch a runtime error.

Welcome to ASIC life.

We're slashing those weeks down to **minutes** — so you can build better chips, _faster_.

**🤔 Why did we build this?**

During our time at Nvidia and other startups, we found that engineers spend large amounts of the 24 month chip design cycle idle, waiting for runs to finish. 

Partcl speeds up Physical Design tools by rearchitecting algorithms for GPUs.

![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXe5Tz9ckaEsmiCOCBRiSkIWoRjsjmlYImpGMRiNjD3CZFjP3cdqz1ak4HZDK-AiUi5j0FQdKDxZg1KI2rG5AafmrCYY-uOiPqU9KHemQSfnwG697XkK2sa2cIsYkjMnY3JCbyG-Lw?key=FiBPpN_VIY8oopQ1FfRq6HI4)

**🧑‍💻What it means for designers:**

* Quick power, performance, and area estimates
* Fix timing/power bugs in RTL w/out handoff to the PD team
* Build better chips, faster

**✅What we have right now:**

* 700X faster Static Timing Analysis - enabling super quick performance simulations
* 100X faster Gate Resizing
* 100X faster global and detailed placement

**🔜What’s in the pipeline:**

* LSP integration for Incremental synthesis - Synthesis as fast as you can type
* Natural Language interface to any intermediate database - Directly query the state of your database with text instead of asking a junior engineer to build you a dashboard

**Our Ask**

Email us at {vamshi, will}@partcl.com to try Partcl and let us know what you think.

Are you building

* **AI Accelerators**? Partcl brings in tapeout deadlines with faster tools, bringing your chip to market faster!
* **Embedded/ IoT devices**? Partcl decreases NRE by shrinking design cycles. Decreased NRE directly translates to higher margins.
* **Mobile SoCs**? Partcl’s physics informed models let you optimize the power-performance tradeoff for your use case.
launches.tagline: Accelerate time to market for a new chip with Partcl.

launches.title: Waffle - Vibe Code Web Apps
launches.body:
**TLDR:** Prompt to website. No 3rd party services like Clerk or Supabase, all integrations built in.

https://youtu.be/Vn-I7osuook

**Vibe Code Web Apps**

With vibe-coding, anyone can make websites without hiring web devs.\
But apps like Lovable and Bolt break when you add backend functionality. 

We want anyone to be able to build fully functional apps with real backends. Imagine you want to build a recipe app! You’ll need:

* File storage → store the recipe images reliably
* Authentication → users can sign up / log in
* Database → persist data like saved recipes
* Email service → send updates to your users

\
In the coming weeks, we’re building integrations for all of these services, so you can do everything you need to, directly within Waffle. No need to sign up to any other 3rd party service like Clerk or Supabase. 

**Team**

Manuj (CEO) was previously 2nd ML hire at unicorn defence startup, Rebellion. He ranked #1 in his Maths & CS Bachelor’s at Imperial College London and graduated from Oxford with a Master’s in Advanced CS. He published a first-author AI paper at UAI 2024.

Diogo (CTO) has built several mobile games. His top original game, Battle Arena, reached 1M users in 70 countries. He did his Bachelor’s in CS at EPFL and dropped out of his Master’s to build Waffle.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90409&key=user_uploads/1276829/10b9cbf1-ab0a-4aac-9db3-eeb6b243f3c2)

# **Our Ask**

If you know anyone who is non-technical and has been wanting to make a website, we’d love to hear their feedback.\
\
Contact us at: [founders@waffle.ai](mailto:founders@waffle.ai)

name: Blaxel
one_liner: AWS for AI Agents
long_description:
Blaxel is a cloud infrastructure to power AI agents. Our platform gives AI companies the toolbox and infrastructure to build and deploy agents efficiently. 

Billions of agents, tools, and models will transform how we work in the coming years. Traditional cloud providers weren't designed to handle them—their one-size-fits-all architecture holds them back. We fixed that with Blaxel.

What is it? A complete computing platform with:

- all services for developers to fast-track deploying agents without reinventing the wheel — like framework-agnostic serverless deployments, an AI gateway for model routing and fallback, and custom MCP server hosting.
- a flexible low-level API for builders to ship really performant agentic AI using our backbone infrastructure — using services like sandboxed VMs usable by agents, a programmable global gateway, and a 20ms-latency serverless compute engine.
- and a seamless developper experience that integrates with their CI/CD, and APIs that can even be consumed by agents themselves!

Founded by Quants and Engineers from Citadel & Tower Research who saw an opportunity to make markets how they always should have been, QFEX will eventually replace the entire $100 billion exchange and clearing industry.

founders.title: Founder

launches.title: QFEX - The Global 24/7 Stock Exchange
launches.body:
Hello World! We’re [Annanay](https://www.linkedin.com/in/annanay-kapila/) and [Joshua](https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshua-wharton/), and we’re building [QFEX](http://www.qfex.com/): a global, 24/7 stock exchange.

#### **What We’ve Built**

Trillions of dollars change hands every day in the global financial markets, but the pace of innovation is excruciatingly slow. As of 2025, you still can’t:

* Trade directly on an exchange **without a broker** (unless you’re as big as Jane Street).
* **Trade 24/7**.
* Get **>20x leverage** or avoid margin fees.
* Trade leveraged US stocks without **worrying about options**.

We’re changing this.

We’ve built an exchange that provides all of the above, packaged into a sleek, **direct-to-market** interface with one-of-a-kind purely **volume-based fees**. Bye-bye Robinhood selling your orders for Citadel to front-run. Adios to the Interactive Brokers GUI. Hello to markets as they _should_ **be**.

https://www.tella.tv/video/joshuas-video-1m32

https://www.tella.tv/video/joshuas-video-32cb

#### **Call To Action**

QFEX is currently running in a closed beta with a white-glove service to match user enthusiasm. To get earlier access: 

* **Sign up** to our [waitlist](https://app.qfex.com/login) to get invited!
* Follow us on socials to make sure you don’t miss out on any early access perks! [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/user/TradeQFEX/) [Twitter](https://x.com/TradeQFEX) [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tradeqfex) [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/entimox/)
* [API](https://docs.qfex.com/) traders - welcome to the first API-native exchange! Reach out [here](mailto:hello@pfex.com) to schedule onboarding.
* Share this post with anyone interested in trading, exchanges or crypto! 

#### **The Team**

We met at Cambridge studying Maths in 2016, and the rest is history. Working as Quants and Engineers at Tower Research and Citadel before YC, we spent a year trying to figure out why crypto exchanges can solve all of the above, but traditional exchanges can’t. We still haven’t found a convincing answer.

#### **PS - For the Crypto/ Finance Bros**

Taking a leaf out of the crypto world, [QFEX](http://www.qfex.com/) is listing Perpetual Futures in traditional assets, making it the first exchange to do so. Futures haven’t changed since the first standardized contract was made in 1865 to help farmers hedge their corn harvests. Now S&P500 futures trade $500 billion daily, but it still expires in time for the harvest. Why?

[QFEX](http://www.qfex.com/) will save institutional traders billions of dollars in rolling costs, operational headache, and deeper liquidity from an unfragmented market - just like perps did for crypto.

name: Chestnut
one_liner: The first AI mortgage lender
long_description:
Chestnut is the first AI mortgage lender. Our AI agents help consumers save 0.5%+ in interest compared to traditional lenders.

Today, 80% of employees at traditional lenders spend hours each day filling out paper forms, manually reviewing documents, and copy-pasting data between systems. These manual processes cost lenders – and ultimately their borrowers – $12,000+ per loan ($61B+ per year).

AI can automate 99% of mortgage operations, but traditional lenders would take 10+ years to adapt. They’d have to overhaul their entire tech stack, rewrite every procedure, and retrain their whole workforce. Chestnut is vertically integrating AI to challenge traditional lenders directly.

Founder Spencer Brown’s previous startup built a mortgage Loan Origination System that powered $85B+ in mortgage volume (1-2% of all US mortgages/yr).

We’re currently licensed in Texas and Colorado, helping clients with home purchases, refinances, cash-outs, and home equity lines of credit.

launches.title: Chestnut, the first AI mortgage lender
launches.body:
tl;dr **-** Chestnut is building **the first AI mortgage lende**r. Our AI agents help people **save 0.5%+ on their rate**.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7ay1fshd-w

—

# 👋 Howdy

I’m Spencer, the founder of Chestnut — **the first AI mortgage lender**. My last startup built a mortgage “Loan Origination System” (system of record + workflow tool used daily by 80% of lender employees) that powered $85B+ in mortgage volume (2% of all US mortgages annually). During that time, I saw firsthand how inefficient traditional lenders are — and realized I should compete with them directly.

# **🤨** Isn’t the mortgage process already automated?

Far from it. Today, 80% of employees at traditional lenders **spend** **hours each day** filling out paper forms, manually reviewing documents, and copy-pasting data between systems. These manual processes cost lenders – and ultimately their borrowers – $12,000+ per loan ($61B+ per year).

# **😲** What’s next?

AI can automate 99% of mortgage operations, but **traditional lenders would take 10+ years** to adapt. They’d have to overhaul their entire tech stack, rewrite every procedure, and retrain their whole workforce.

# ➡️ Enter Chestnut

Chestnut is **vertically integrating AI** to challenge traditional lenders directly. Besides Ashley, our AI loan officer assistant, we’ve also built agents that:

1. **Find the best deals** by shopping rates across 100+ lenders (since we’re starting with brokering),
2. **Cut borrowing costs** by automating the origination process, and
3. **Notify clients** when rates drop.

So far, we’re licensed in Texas and Colorado where we’re helping clients with new home purchases, refinances, home equity loans, and home equity lines of credit.

# 🤑 Ready to save?

If you’re exploring mortgage options in Texas or Colorado, **head over to [our website](https://chestnutmortgage.com?utm_source=launch-yc&utm_medium=cta-link&utm_campaign=launch-yc)** where you can get an instant quote and compare our rates to other lenders!

—

Cheers!

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90630&key=user_uploads/285403/adefaf94-0d5d-4bad-aafc-788d26e493ee)

Frekil helps healthcare AI teams, medical device companies, and pharmaceutical companies procure and annotate medical images like X-rays, CTs, MRIs, etc., efficiently for AI training, clinical trials, and FDA approvals. We also provide tools to track annotator performance, build custom workflows, and increase labeling accuracy. By combining efficiency with precision, Frekil enables teams to build high-quality datasets much faster, supporting the development and deployment of reliable medical AI and clinical research solutions.

launches.title: Frekil - Scale AI for Medical Scans 🚀
launches.body:
Hey everyone, we’re [Nikhil](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nikhiltiwari-iitb/) & [Shivesh](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shivesh-gupta-iitb/), co-founders of Frekil!  👋

## TL;DR

Frekil is an end-to-end platform to procure and annotate medical imaging datasets like Xrays, CTs, MRIs, etc 10x faster with AI assistance. We’ve partnered with radiology chains for large-scale imaging data, and have a global marketplace of radiologists for rapid, high-quality annotations.

https://youtu.be/2MYjUFp3r0Q?feature=shared

## ❗The Problem

AI is transforming healthcare, but the biggest bottleneck is still **access to medical images from hospitals and annotations by expert doctors**.

Healthcare AI and life sciences companies spend millions collecting medical images and hiring expert radiologists. But annotations? They're still:

📝 Manual\
🐢 Slow\
🔍 Hard to QA

Finding expert annotators with deep domain knowledge is tough, which means R&D teams waste months and large budgets on a process that should be seamless.

Medical annotation itself is uniquely challenging because it involves:

📦 Gigabyte-scale files\
🧠 Complex, multi-dimensional data that’s sensitive to loss\
🎯 Accuracy that’s absolutely critical

Yet most teams still use open-source desktop tools like 3D Slicer, built decades ago for solo researchers. These tools:

🚫 Require local machines\
📉 Offer no real-time collaboration\
📊 Force spreadsheet-based coordination\
🔐 Risk compliance and data security

And the result?\
Highly trained radiologists are stuck doing repetitive tasks manually wasting time, slowing innovation, and compromising data quality.

## 🧠 Our Solution

We transform the way healthcare AI teams prepare data by **accelerating and streamlining the entire annotation pipeline** — cutting timelines from months down to days.

Here’s how:

✅ Deliver fully annotated **medical datasets** tailored for AI research needs

✅ Provide certified and benchmarked **radiologists** for annotation and quality assurance

✅ Offer advanced, browser-based annotation tools for all kinds of medical images—radiology, pathology, histopathology, including X-ray, CT, MRI, ultrasound, etc

✅ Use **AI assistance** to make annotators **10x faster**

✅ Enable customizable clinical workflows with multi-stage reviews & annotations

✅ Ensure **FDA-Ready** annotation versioning, consensus checks, and full audit trails

✅ Track annotator performance in cost, time, and **accuracy** - all built in

### 🤝 The Team

![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXctdUlgsBRg891fZ4XU-Ve5trM2bw_h1PYuoQCy0NxrUigEoWMrHYVBO3D3IoAaUC7UPvtDzGxg0C_x2gyO0ujmyJs3_FxtXpLzIVPiUfIZqDKotuf5oeOiGmHyyPRLAzeDm9ORsA?key=Rm0k0m7MflJlURnfdp3zng)

Nikhil (left) and Shivesh (right) have been friends since their days at **IIT Bombay**, studying and building together. While working on healthcare AI projects, they experienced firsthand how painful annotation can be especially for large, multi-dimensional medical images that demand extreme accuracy.

[**Nikhil**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nikhiltiwari-iitb/) (CEO) - Former software engineer at **Stripe, Amazon**, and Marsh McLennan, where he worked on infrastructure, performance optimization, and low-level systems. He graduated from **IIT Bombay** last year, where he led technical initiatives in the student body SARC and built platforms used by 10,000+ students.

[**Shivesh**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shivesh-gupta-iitb/) (CTO) - Former systems software engineer at **Sony Japan**. He holds an engineering degree from **IIT Bombay**. During his time there, he worked on healthcare AI research and also led the institute’s web and coding club.

## 👋 Our Ask

Know someone building AI in healthcare whether it’s diagnostic models, clinical trial workflows, or robotic surgery? We’d love to connect.

We have special offers for academic research, connect us with professors at your university working in healthcare AI!

Got questions or want to chat? Reach out anytime at [founders@frekil.com](mailto:founders@frekil.com) !

Or book a call directly at https://calendly.com/nikhil-frekil/30min

launches.title: Plexe - Build ML models from a prompt
launches.body:
We’re Vaibhav and Marcello. We’re building Plexe, an open-source agent that turns natural language task descriptions into trained ML models.

https://youtu.be/CwNX0aU9MsE

## **🤔 1. Problem**

Lots of great use cases for ML models in businesses never materialize because ML projects are messy and convoluted. You spend months finding the data, cleaning it, experimenting with models and deploying them to production, only to find out that the project has been binned due to taking so long. At a previous employer, we witnessed a team of 10 ML engineers spend 2 years and $3M building models for a project that never saw the light of day. 

There are several tools for “automating” ML, but it still takes teams of ML experts to actually productionize something of value. And we can’t keep throwing LLMs at every ML problem. Why use a generic 10B parameter language model, if a logistic regression trained on your data could do the job better?

## **✅ 2. Solution**

Step 1: Connect your data sources\
Step 2: Describe your problem statement\
Step 3: Use the deployed model via API

https://youtu.be/zByvH0wTSuE

## **🚀 3. How does it work?**

Plexe uses a self-correcting team of ML engineering agents to research, experiment, evaluate, refine, and deploy the best performing model over an API endpoint. It connects to data sources, discovering relevant fields, and autonomously building the model. Think of it like your own ML helper helping you go from idea to deployed models 10x faster.

https://youtu.be/bUwCSglhcXY

## **👋 4. Team**

[Vaibhav Dubey](https://bookface.ycombinator.com/user/2260416) (ex-Proofpoint, Expedia, Imperial College London) and [Marcello De Bernardi](https://bookface.ycombinator.com/user/2337737) (ex-AWS, Expedia, Oxford) met 6 years ago while building a chatbot that served 9+ million customers of a large bank. Since then, they’ve built enterprise-scale ML solutions that serve billions of predictions per day for millions of users worldwide.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90589&key=user_uploads/2260416/4e5a0513-e013-4adc-9520-ebde07c44981)

## **🙏 5. Our ask**

* We’d love to get in touch with any companies that have a lot of data but have not been able to build ML features on top of them!
* If you’re an individual who believes that the future of ML development is autonomous and open source, check out our agent: https://github.com/plexe-ai/plexe

Get in touch with us: [founders@plexe.ai](mailto:founders@plexe.ai)

name: Vybe
one_liner: Lovable for internal apps
long_description:
We're 2 repeat YC founders. We founded Plato (W16, sold to Coda) and Wolfia (S22). Quang lead Product/GTM for Coda Solutions and Fabien is ex-SWE at Meta and lead Engineering at Wealthfront before.

We’re building Vybe: "Lovable for internal apps". We come with pre-built building blocks: Integrations (Gmail, Gcal, Github, Jira, etc.), SSO and AI tools (Websearch, Summarization etc.) so anyone in a company can build and launch internal AI-powered apps.

Vibe coding is dramatically lowering the barrier for non-technical users to create full web apps. Lovable, Replit, Bolt, Google, Canva, Figma all launched their vibe-coding platforms. People love them. They're great for prototyping, but it's difficult to roll out inside a company for internal use cases for those reasons: 

1. Data: If you want to connect your existing data (e.g. Salesforce, Gmail, Jira), you'd need to rebuild the API auth, pagination, etc. 

2. SSO: If you build 20 apps, you'll have 20 different logins

3. Security: AI-built apps have massive risk of exposing data, especially if built by non developers

So companies are stuck in the old world: clunky spreadsheets, rigid SaaS solutions or complex no-code tools.

Time to build!

launches.title: Vybe - Lovable for internal apps
launches.body:
Fabien (Wolfia, S22) and myself (Plato, W16), are back to building again and today, we’re excited to share what we've been cooking for the past few months! And we’re part of the current batch!

We’re building a Lovable for internal apps. We come with pre-built building blocks: Integrations, SSO, and AI tools so anyone in a company can build and launch internal apps.

https://youtu.be/jaB3EnuU_cI

I included 5-6 other examples of things I built to run Vybe on vybe below :)

# The unsolved problem:

Fast‑growing teams drown in \_glue work\_—onboarding trackers, launch calendars, status bots, one‑off scripts. Each steals engineering time, rots when its owner leaves, and derails sprints.

It leaves companies with three bad options:

* Rigid enterprise SaaS – inflexible, forces your process to fit the tool.
* Spreadsheets & docs – endless copy‑paste, no live data, fragile at scale.
* DIY glue & drag‑and‑drop no‑code – a tangle of scripts and widgets that collapse when owners leave.

# **Why current vibe coding tools aren’t enough:**

Vibe coding is dramatically lowering the barrier for non-technical users to create full web apps. Lovable, Replit, Bolt, Google, Canva, Figma all launched their vibe-coding platforms. People love them. They're great for prototyping, but it's difficult to roll out inside a company for internal use cases for those reasons:

* Data: If you want to connect your existing data (e.g. Salesforce, Gmail, Jira), you'd need to rebuild the API auth, pagination, etc.
* SSO: If you build 20 apps, you'll have 20 different logins…
* Security: AI-built apps have the massive risk of exposing data, especially if built by non-developers

Cursor and Windsurf are not adapted either. They’re built for devs, hard to use for non-technical folks. My Head of HR doesn’t know how to deploy an app in Netlify or Vercel.

# **Why old no-code tools are solutions of the past:**

* Airtable / Retool / Coda: No‑code and low‑code platforms showed you can build dashboards faster than hand‑coding React—but you're still dragging rectangles, hunting for SQL, and rebuilding the same CRUD table for the hundredth time.
* Large‑language models have changed the game. Code‑gen IDEs already write production‑grade functions from chat—so why are we still moving boxes to connect Salesforce to a launch‑approval form?

**We’d love your help:**

1. Companies: Design partners: Pick a painful process internally in your company, let us rebuild it in a more robust way.
2. Users: -> Join the waitlist: https://www.vybe.build/ and we’ll accept you as fast as we can! Comment "waitlist" or re-post, and we'll bump you to the top of the list!

Here are some nice examples of things I built on Vybe:

**A daily briefer of my day,** an AI is doing a web search on every single person I’m meeting every day:

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/f071030a-e15f-4df2-9ae3-6f09d2add985)

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/2789a7da-2558-434e-abc2-8836d9a4f205)

**A weekly goals tracker** with a count down until YC demo day:

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/9296e031-ab0a-4b39-82cd-9905c961f08d)

**Our backlog/roadmap** of things to ship:

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/7a626545-91b5-4258-8dd9-6db0dc33c2ae)

**Our DB Admin** fed by our production database (postgres) built in 10 mins:

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/aa9494e4-89f9-4ebd-b005-2b9a8b8b2c3f)

**A simple to-do** i created with routines, timer and link to my tech backlog so i can easily add tasks to myself from the roadmap

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/75b7bfc7-baa9-4198-8613-a46b2f7434dd)

\*\*A nice CRM (\*\*no, i don’t use Salesforce, Hubspot or any other CRM) that is connected to my postgres so i can monitor deals and usages at the same place

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90606&key=user_uploads/3335/36acd4ee-8bb7-495d-b1a0-802346cf57e6)

And check tens of other examples: https://www.vybe.build/examples

It’s time to build 💪 Join the waitlist: https://www.vybe.build/ and we’ll accept you as fast as we can! Comment "waitlist" and we'll bump you to the top of the list!

launches.title: nao Labs - Cursor for data
launches.body:
**🥷 Manifesto**

Data teams have been left out of the vibe coding party. We’re building nao so they can **data vibe** too.

**🏎 TL;DR**

nao is an **AI code editor to write code on data**: a local editor, connected to your data warehouse, with an AI copilot that has context of both your data schema and codebase.\
It’s built specifically for data workflows - helping teams write faster, better code, while being ensured of the data quality.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90397&key=user_uploads/1535815/f9051a44-1d1e-41a0-b995-e6bcb94a4c31)

**🧑‍💻 Who is it for?**

* **Data teams** who run analytics with SQL and build dbt or Python pipelines
* **Software developers** who manage SQL databases

**🤖 What can you do with nao?**

You can prompt nao **AI agent** to:

* **Create SQL queries & dbt models** from your data warehouse tables
* Add **documentation & testing** to your data
* **Refactor** your codebase through your **lineage**
* Perform **data quality checks**, **data diff** tests
* Run **conversational analytics**

**nao AI tab auto-suggests code for your data** — only with tables, columns and data that actually exist in your warehouse.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90397&key=user_uploads/1535815/08d1f6f0-b247-4887-b179-c0f5f2cd8405)

**🔆 Why we built it**

Christophe and Claire have each spent 10 years in data. We’ve seen that data teams can’t keep the business pace because making changes in data requires too many tools and tests.\
Current AI code editors don’t interact natively with data warehouses — they autocomplete SQL blindly, not knowing your data schema. We built nao so that data teams can ship at business pace, with an AI code editor that has all their context.

**👀 Watch it live**

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QmG6X-5ftZU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QmG6X-5ftZU&ab_channel=ClaireGouze)

**👋🏻 Our ask**

Want to write code on your data faster?

* **Download** and test nao here: [**https://getnao.io/**](https://getnao.io/**)
* **Contact us** for team plans: [claire@getnao.io](mailto:claire@getnao.io)

launches.title: Golf:  Open-source platform for shipping production MCP servers
launches.body:
Hi YC,

We’re Wojciech and Antoni -  high school friends who’ve been building together since we were 14. We're incredibly bullish on a future where AI agents have their own internet through which they access our services - so much so that we dropped out of university to build Golf.

**Golf lets you ship a production-ready MCP server without worrying about the plumbing.** You just write the tools, prompts, and resources you want agents to call. Golf handles everything else - routing, auth, telemetry, error reporting, and deployment. Then you can observe and manage it through our gateway.

https://youtu.be/u9ar4w2uE7E

# **The problem**

Over the past few weeks, we spoke with over 40 teams building MCP servers. Everyone hit the same walls: wiring up authentication, figuring out how to trace agent calls, setting up working transports, and debugging behavior in production. The MCP spec doesn’t cover these parts. Teams told us it takes **2-4 weeks** to get that to production.

# **What we built**

**GolfMCP** is an open-source framework that gives you a clear, file-based structure to define what your agent can call. No decorators, no spec knowledge, no boilerplate - just write your logic.

**Golf Gateway** is the hosted layer that runs and observes your server. golf deploy gives you a live server in under 60 seconds, with real-time traces, tool usage, and error monitoring built in.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90569&key=user_uploads/1366358/b035bdc4-02c2-42d5-a230-ad38be34dfa9)

# **Early traction**

We’re already running Golf in production with companies, and we’ve got more landing this week. 

**CTAs**\
If you are looking to ship server for your company, schedule a demo of our platform here: https://golf.dev\
Also we’d love to get your feedback, and we’re happy to help teams get to production faster. Reach us at [founders@golf.dev](mailto:founders@golf.dev)
launches.tagline: We provide the tooling to build and operate MCP servers in production - auth, tracing, and a deployment pipeline included.

launches.title: Notus Systems 🦉 Scaling drones from hundreds to thousands
launches.body:
# **How do you win a war?**

It’s a question most people don’t want to ever have to answer.

**But for the first time since WW2, democracy is under direct attack.**

Defense companies can make billions selling theoretical solutions, but once sh\*\* hits the fan and missiles are landing ten kilometers from your apartment, you’re going to want what works. Quickly.

So we dropped out of Caltech and went to Ukraine to figure out what really worked. Amidst Russian shaheds striking in the distance and Kyiv’s air defenses lighting up the sky, we met with soldiers, hackers, and engineers. Their striking kindness and hospitality in the face of total mobilization and a ceaseless stream of air raid sirens was indescribable. The invasion wasn’t just war, but _industrialized hatred._

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90281&key=user_uploads/2575745/03cd93d8-01b6-477c-bb34-825ba2c5f171)

\
It turns out war is hacking. Drones and robots – code – now dictate the battlefield. Gear from big name U.S. defense tech becomes obsolete in a month. The pipeline from R&D to testing to the battlefield is too slow for a real war.\
\
So we’re making a new defense company, one which leads from the front. Literally. Our first product, PALLAS, will resolve ad-hoc drone software standards and replace the FPV operator with a drone commander–allowing them to pilot thousands of devices at once instead of just one. Handcrafted from combat user feedback, it will be optimized for victory – not ticking boxes in a contract.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90281&key=user_uploads/2575745/518325b4-9458-4d5b-9cd6-b17ca1a69464)

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90281&key=user_uploads/2575745/ffee1ea6-7489-4e27-9753-db14843f832c)

\-Emmanuel Margolin, Arhum Jain.\
Please contact us for detailed specifics on our software, what we learnt about modern war in Ukraine, and the engineering that will allow a single ground-station to control many different types of devices, including in EW affected areas. \
[founders@notussystems.com](mailto:founders@notussystems.com).\
[www.notussystems.com](http://www.notussystems.com)

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90281&key=user_uploads/2575745/8a589db1-72ee-42f9-85bb-7fe961b95584)

name: cubic
one_liner: AI-powered code review platform
long_description:
Code review is a major bottleneck for software teams, and the rise of AI-generated code is making the problem worse. Reviewing large volumes of code slows devs down, and increases the chances of bugs slipping through.

That's why we're building cubic: an intelligent code review platform that helps devs merge PRs 40% faster.

How? 
- When you open a PR, cubic automatically reviews it. It learns from your codebase's patterns, points out bugs, suggesting fixes, and frees you from low-level review tasks.
- You then jump into the cubic platform, which is designed to optimize how humans review code. For example, file changes are organized in a logical order instead of alphabetical, and cubic generates diagrams of architecture changes.

launches.title: cubic – Cursor for code review
launches.body:
**🎯 TL;DR**

cubic is an AI-powered code review platform that automatically reviews PRs and gives human reviewers superpowers.

It helps teams like [**cal.com**](http://cal.com), **n8n**, and the **Linux Foundation** ship code 28% faster.

https://youtu.be/7bzIJYy0Nfw

Hey! 👋 We’re Allis and Paul – founders of cubic.

We’re building cubic – an AI code review platform to help teams ship code faster with fewer bugs.

[🚀 See it in action for cal.com here](https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/pull/20771)

🎁 **Launch deal**

If you’re a developer, and you feel like code reviews are slowing you down + bugs slip through, give cubic a try.

It’s free for 2 weeks, and you’ll get an extra 30% off for 2 months with the code: _YCLAUNCH_

[**Just sign up with your Github account to get started!**](http://cubic.dev/home)

**⭐️ Why did we start cubic?**

We’re engineers who faced this problem when we worked together in the past. As we adopted more AI code gen tools, code review and ensuring quality quickly became our biggest bottleneck.

We had more PRs to review, subtle AI-written bugs slipped in, and we (humans) found ourselves rubber-stamping PRs without deeply understanding the changes.

**👷 We’re building cubic to help solve that. Here’s how it works:**

1. Connect your GitHub repo via our Github app in two clicks
2. AI review: When you open a PR, our AI reviews your changes directly in a secure container. It has context into not just that PR, but your whole codebase, so it can pick up patterns and leave comments directly on changed lines. Once the review is done, the sandbox is torn down and your code deleted.
3. Human-friendly review workflow: Jump into our web (or desktop) app (it’s like Linear but for PRs). Changes are grouped logically (not alphabetically), with important diffs highlighted, visualized, and ready for faster human review.

💻 The AI reviewer works a bit like Cursor in the sense that it navigates your codebase using the same tools a developer would—like jumping to definitions or grepping through code.

⚡️ The platform itself focuses entirely on making _human_ code reviews easier. A big inspiration came from productivity-focused apps like Linear or Superhuman, products that show just how much thoughtful design can impact everyday workflows. We wanted to bring that same feeling to code review.

That’s one reason we built a desktop app. It allowed us to deliver a more polished experience, complete with keyboard shortcuts and a snappy interface.

We think the future of coding isn’t about AI replacing humans—it’s about giving us better tools to quickly understand high-level changes, abstracting more and more of the code itself. As code volume continues to increase, this shift is going to become increasingly important.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90581&key=user_uploads/1453819/af22052f-6cbe-4cc6-863f-9dd72f10add5)
launches.tagline: cubic helps teams like cal.com and n8n ship 28% faster

launches.title: GroundControl: Vertical AI for highly-regulated manufacturing
launches.body:
Hi! We’re [**Mehul Shah**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mehulmshah22), [**Nick Warren**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nickcw/), [**Matthew Noseworthy**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthew-noseworthy-218167106/) — co-founders of [**GroundControl**](https://rungroundcontrol.com/).

[**https://youtu.be/s2heFLI1R80**](https://youtu.be/s2heFLI1R80)

**TL;DR** — We've onboarded 70+ manufacturing facilities as customers throughout the US. Our core product automates lengthy, complex, and regulated quality documentation in aerospace manufacturing.

**How We Started**

Nick and Matt co-founded their last startup (InspectAR) with Mehul's brother before being acquired by Cadence ($CDNS). I (Mehul) spent the last decade in my family business, where we built PCBs for every advanced system on Earth: rockets, satellites, aircraft, fighter jets, and more. We noticed despite building for innovation, manufacturing operations were antiquated and bogged down with manual processes.

First Article Inspection Reports (AS9102s) were creating a bottleneck in quality. Parts would be built and ready to ship, just waiting on paperwork. Our facilities were doing 15 reports a day, 8 hours per report. The worst part? Even if the part was built exactly to spec — if a single typo was found by the customer, the report would get rejected and payment delayed until the report was fixed.

**What We Built**

Our core product automates first article inspection reporting for regulated manufacturing. Quality teams can balloon drawings and automate inspection report generation in minutes, instead of days.

**Our Vision**

Today, over 70 facilities across the US generate almost 1000 reports a month on our platform. This is just the beginning. We'll continue to build for quality, and upstream towards operations, engineering, and sales to empower manufacturers with AI. GroundControl will embed itself across the global supply chain, from Tier 4 suppliers to OEMs with vertically integrated manufacturing.

**Our Ask**

If you know anyone in regulated manufacturing (aerospace, automotive, medical), or their customers (OEMs like Lockheed, SpaceX, Anduril, etc.) we would love to chat. Reach us at [**founders@gndctl.com**](mailto:founders@gndctl.com) or **408-390-4460**.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90406&key=user_uploads/1816593/5a76bc6a-30b2-49fb-9e27-43c222bcab9d)

launches.title: Kanava - Your First AI Sales Hire for Wholesale Distributors
launches.body:
**Industrial Sales teams are underwater. Here’s why - and what we’re doing to fix it.**

Hi everyone! We’re [Smit](https://www.linkedin.com/in/smitdagli/) and [Vik](https://www.linkedin.com/in/vikhyath-m-a00357128/) - the founders of [Kanava AI](https://kanava.ai/)

**Problem and Opportunity:**

The wholesale distribution industry is massive: _$9T+ in annual revenue. 410,000+ businesses. 6 million+ employees._

And yet — sales teams are drowning.

* **A third of the workforce is over 55**, and replacements aren’t coming fast enough.

  (“Most of my sales reps are **retiring in the next 2-3 years**, I have **NO idea** what I’ll do after” - a medium sized electrical goods distributor from Indiana we met)
* **Reps spend less than 30% of their time selling**. The rest? Answering repetitive calls (“What’s the price of this SKU?” “Which warehouse has it?”), digging through systems, and manual follow-ups.
* **Over 25% of inbound calls never reach a human** — lost revenue, lost trust, lost time.

This isn’t just inefficiency. It’s operational drag at scale — and it's only getting worse.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s1NVVxRnLL8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s1NVVxRnLL8%5C%5C)

**How’re we solving it:**

We’re building Kanava AI, a voice-based AI agent designed for wholesale distributors.

It handles repetitive tasks like **answering stock, price,** and **order status calls** using live **ERP** data and logging **field notes hands-free**, drafting follow-ups, updating the **CRM** all _automatically_.

It’s like a junior rep-in-training. It starts with the basics, but improves quickly by learning from the company’s best performers. Over time, Kanava takes on more:

•⁠ **⁠Managing consultative sales calls** \
•⁠ ⁠**Identifying upsell opportunities** in real time \
•⁠ ⁠**Surfacing coaching insights** from rep conversations \
•⁠ ⁠**Re-engaging dormant accounts** with timely, data-backed outreach

And by the time these reps are ready to retire, Kanava is **ready to fill the void they leave.**

Most AI tools in this space fail because they try to do too much, too early, and distributors are famously late adopters. We’re taking a more deliberate path: start with low-leverage work, prove value, and scale responsibility as the system earns it.

**Our Team**

Vik (CTO) and Smit (CEO) know each other since freshman year of college at UC Berkeley. Both of us studied CS, and worked as AI engineers at various startups before deciding to build our own thing and join YC.

**Smit:** Built incident resolution agents at a series B observability startup called Observe. Previously worked at Abnormal Security and Salesforce.

**Vik**: Built voice agents for numerical data entry and hands-free navigation for a data management platform called Uncountable. Previously worked at Uber and Amazon.

We’re both outsiders to the wholesale distribution industry, but we’re listening hard and learning fast.

What made us really want to work together was being on the same ultimate frisbee team in the senior year of college - that team was a disaster, we lost every single game we played by huge margins, but despite that, we had a ton of fun and stuck together!

**Our Ask** If you know any **distributors, field sales heavy businesses or IMR’s (Independent Manufacturer Reps)**, we’d appreciate a connection at [smit@kanava.ai](mailto:smit@kanava.ai) or [vikhyath@kanava.ai](mailto:vikhyath@kanava.ai). We’ll make their lives a lot easier and buy you a coffee ☕🤎

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90571&key=user_uploads/2493431/bdc2c377-20b6-4db8-ac56-448fb5adafa6)

launches.title: Minerva - AI Accountant for SMBs
launches.body:
Hi everyone 👋 we’re [Peter](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhudanmeng/) & [Om](https://www.linkedin.com/in/om-agarwal/). We’re building the future of accounting.

**TL;DR**

**Minerva:** Automated, end-to-end business accounting—at a fraction of the cost.

* **Seamless data capture:** Instantly syncs with Email, WhatsApp, Stripe, Shopify, Drive and any platform where money moves.
* **Zero manual work:** From transaction categorization through bookkeeping and reconciliation to tax-ready reports and filings.
* **Smart tax guidance:** Real-time insights and personalized strategies to minimize liabilities and boost cash flow.

**_Ask:_**\_ Need accurate, instant accounting services? Email: [om@tryminerva.ai](https://mailto:om@tryminerva.ai) or [book a demo here](https://calendar.notion.so/meet/omagarwal061002/link).

**Launch video**

https://youtu.be/ntPnAkXBJ9E

**What we do**

We believe accountants will not exist in 10 years. AI has just now made it possible to automate almost every single task they do, and we are here to capitalize on that. We aim to replace all bookkeeping, accounting and tax filing jobs within small businesses globally.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90474&key=user_uploads/699602/a3d4cbc1-3f96-4b78-a0ee-87bd139773c5)

Traditional software (Quickbooks/Xero) can’t think, and traditional accountants (Fondo/Finta) can’t scale—we need something more.

Minerva delivers CFO-level intelligence through AI—ready to ingest every bank feed, invoice, chat, and doc. It is the most agentic accountant you will ever have.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90474&key=user_uploads/699602/c9e3451a-5601-44c8-af81-4d119e8ff2fd)


**Minerva is a CFO-grade, AI-powered accounting service that:**

* **Ingests everything.** Pulls bank feeds, invoices, chats, docs—then learns your revenue streams and approval quirks automatically.
* **Writes the follow-ups.** Auto-emails vendors, customers, or teammates to chase receipts, fix POs, or renegotiate terms—politely and persistently.
* **Answers instantly.** Type “burn-rate trend” or “campaign ROI” and get audit-ready numbers plus a plain-English blurb.
* **Autopilots your P&L.** Spots gaps in real time, pings the right person, and reconciles the moment data lands—no month-end scramble.
* **Looks forward, not back.** Runs live 13-week cash forecasts, Monte-Carlo stress tests, and hiring “what-ifs,” refreshing every few minutes.
* **Turns regulations into refunds.** Tracks global tax codes, surfaces every credit or deduction, prepares the forms, and e-files on time.
* **Optimizes cash like a treasury desk.** Sweeps idle balances into high-yield accounts, times payments for float and discounts, and flags financing options before gaps appear.
* **Tells the story.** Auto-builds board decks, KPI dashboards, and investor memos—charts, insights, even voice-overs included.
* **Stays audit-ready.** Maintains a time-stamped evidence vault and runs continuous mock audits.
* **Learns on its own.** Each close cycle sharpens categorization and forecasts—no upgrades needed.
* **Integrates everywhere.** From Stripe to Shopify, Slack to WhatsApp—if it holds financial signal, it’s in scope.

**The Team**

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90474&key=user_uploads/699602/ad5b3f23-b22c-496d-a475-06e827cb1aa8)

[@Peter Zhu](https://bookface.ycombinator.com/user/317122) (left), [@Om Agarwal](https://bookface.ycombinator.com/user/699602) (right). We’re from Canada & met at an international science fair during high school. We have been building together ever since! We both have 2 decades of combined experience building software.

---

Check us out @ [tryminerva.ai](http://tryminerva.ai)

Contact us @ [om@tryminerva.ai](mailto:om@tryminerva.ai)

launches.title: c/ua - Docker Container for Computer-Use Agents
launches.body:
### **📚 TL;DR**

**c/ua** is an open-source framework that enables AI agents to control full operating systems within high-performance, lightweight virtual containers. It delivers up to **97% native CPU speed on Apple Silicon** and works with any language models: [**https://github.com/trycua/cua**](https://github.com/trycua/cua).

<https://youtu.be/Ee9qf-13gho>

### **⚒️ The Problem**

For **Computer-Use AI agents** to be genuinely useful, they must interact with your system's native applications. But giving full access to your host device is **risky** - and not ideal. What if the agent's process gets compromised, or the LLM hallucinates and leaks your data? And practically speaking, do you really want to **give up control** of your entire machine just so the agent can do its job?

**In short: How can AI agents interact with operating systems, desktop applications, and browsers without jeopardizing security or sacrificing performance?**

### **⭐ Solution: An end-to-end framework**

We combined **Apple's Virtualization.Framework** with an agent-friendly interface to create:

\- **Lightweight VMs**: Run at 97% of native CPU speed on Apple Silicon, giving you near-native performance in a secure, virtualized space.

\- **Sandboxed Execution**: AI agents operate in tightly controlled environments, allowing secure interaction with desktop applications - without risking your host system.

\- **LLM-Compatible Runtimes**: Works out-of-the-box with popular LLM providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, and open-source tools like Ollama, LM Studio, and OpenRouter.

And we now support **MCP**! You can use Claude Desktop or Cursor, as your personal assistant to navigate even notoriously challenging apps like Tableau. Watch the demo to see it in action!

[**https://youtu.be/NTUVU1aBs3c**](https://youtu.be/NTUVU1aBs3c)

### **⚙️ How It Works**

**c/ua** brings together three powerful components into one unified framework stack:

1\. **Lume** - Our high-performance Virtualization layer leverages Apple's Virtualization.Framework to spin up macOS or Linux environments.

2\. **Computer-Use Interface (CUI)** - This layer lets any process or AI agent - no matter which framework it's built on (like AutoGen, LangGraph, etc.) - see the screen and interact with Lume VMs just like a human would. It supports actions such as clicking, typing, scrolling, and extracting the visual accessibility tree.

3\. **Computer-Use Agent (CUA)** - Built on top of CUI, this general agent framework runs intelligent workflows within these VMs. It's compatible with popular LLM providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, as well as open-source tools like Ollama, LM Studio, and OpenRouter.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=89628&key=user_uploads/1644303/c3e0e845-3223-4b82-85d1-316e41d9875c)

An AI agent built with **c/ua** operates within a virtual environment to:

\- Navigate and interact with any application's interface

\- Read screen content and perform keyboard/mouse actions

\- Switch between applications and self-debug when needed

\- Operate in a secure sandbox with controlled file access

All of this occurs in a fully isolated environment, ensuring your host system, files, and sensitive data remain completely secure - while you continue using your device without interruption.

### **🖥️ What Can You Build with c/ua?**

**c/ua** lets AI agents use real desktop apps - just like a human. For example:

\- **CAD Copilot**: Modify 3D models in tools like Fusion 360 or FreeCAD.

\- **Photoshop Assistant**: Crop, layer, and export assets via prompt.

\- **Operator for Tableau**: Navigate dashboards and filters with natural language.

\- **Legacy App Automator**: Control apps and websites with no APIs through UI actions.

### **🤝 Our Asks:**

If you're done burning money on fragile browser automations or slow, over-engineered computer-use agents - it's time to try c/ua:

* Book a call: <https://cal.com/francesco-bonacci/cua-demo>
* Email us: [founders@trycua.com](mailto:founders@trycua.com)

Also don’t forget to:

1\. Leave us a star, watch and fork on GitHub: [**https://github.com/trycua/cua**](https://github.com/trycua/cua)

2\. Join our Discord [**https://discord.com/invite/mVnXXpdE85**](https://discord.com/invite/mVnXXpdE85) - we're building this together

name: Galen AI
one_liner: AI agent for healthcare, powered by clinical and wearable data.
long_description:
Galen is an AI-powered personal healthcare companion. We enable patients to securely connect their medical records from over 800 healthcare institutions across more than 12,000 locations in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada. We also connect with over 20 popular wearable devices including Apple Watch, Fitbit, and Dexcom, bringing all your medical records and health data into one unified space. 

We founded Galen because for over four years, Viraj struggled to navigate several conditions related to chronic low back pain. He often found himself waiting weeks for responses from his care team, received little guidance or education about new diagnoses, and was overwhelmed trying to manage overlapping conditions and medications.

His experiences are not unique. Our healthcare system is overloaded and fragmented, and often, patients are left to navigate their care on their own. Everyday there are nearly 1 billion health-related Google searches, but the responses to such queries are generic and impersonalized, because the searches lack any insight into a users personal health background.

By leveraging your own data and state-of-the art LLM memory capabilities, Galen delivers personalized insights, proactive health recommendations, and 24/7 on-demand medical support — empowering patients to be an active part of their health team. We are a consumer app in beta testing and will be available on the App Store soon!

launches.title: Galen 🩺 AI Healthcare Agent for Patients
launches.body:
👋 Hey, I’m [Viraj](https://www.linkedin.com/in/virajmehta28/), and along with my cofounder [Priyanka](https://www.linkedin.com/in/priyanka-shrestha-/) I’m excited to introduce Galen AI!

**TL;DR:** Galen is your on-demand AI healthcare assistant, securely connecting all your health data to provide highly personalized support.

https://youtu.be/sTh-Af8mAx4

**Our Main Ask:** if you want to stay on top of your health, join our [waitlist](https://getwaitlist.com/waitlist/28135) and keep an eye out for our upcoming App Store launch!

Can’t wait get started? Email us at [founders@galenai.com](mailto:founders@galenai.com) to join our private beta and start getting health insights today!

**💥 The Problem**

For 4+ years now, I’ve struggled to navigate several chronic low back conditions. I often waited weeks for responses from my care team, received little guidance about new diagnoses, and felt overwhelmed trying to manage overlapping conditions and medications.

I found myself turning to ChatGPT. A lot. And quickly, Priyanka and I realized my experience is not unique…it’s the norm. Our healthcare system is overloaded and fragmented, doctors are pressed for time, and patients are expected navigate the majority of it alone.

Increasingly, **patients are trusting LLMs with their health questions**, but these tools weren’t built to understand a person’s full clinical history, wearable data, and evolving health context, so they fall short of delivering truly personalized insights.

**🧠 Our Solution**

Meet Galen AI — our AI-powered solution to make high-quality, personal medical support accessible to everyone. No more screenshotting your records and uploading them to ChatGPT. No more WebMD rabbit holes about your symptoms. No more waiting months for your next doctor’s appointment.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90700&key=user_uploads/1833511/b89751e0-80e4-479d-aa23-bf7209579b13)

**All Your Medical Data in One Place**

Galen securely integrates with **Apple HealthKit** to connect directly to your medical records, allowing you to unify health data from all your providers and institutions in one place.

It also syncs with your **Apple Watch** to bring in daily fitness and activity data, with support for **20+ additional wearables** coming soon.

As you share new symptoms and health updates, Galen **keeps track** and **continuously learns** about your evolving needs, providing long-term support.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90700&key=user_uploads/1833511/cc5d7b50-ea97-4b63-926e-92bb25049ead)

**Talk to Your Health Data**

Once your records are connected, you can:

* Receive clear, **comprehensive summaries** of your medical history
* Ask questions about and **uncover patterns** in your health data
* **Understand new symptoms** in the context of your existing conditions
* **Receive tailored insights** about medication side effects or interactions, comorbidities, and treatment impacts

🌲 **Meet the Team!**

We met working on a class project at Stanford and haven’t stopped building together since.

Priyanka, originally pre-med, conducted clinical and biocomputation research at Stanford SAIL, Cleveland Clinic, and UCLA, and worked as a software engineer at Roche. I worked as an engineer at Optiver and quantitative trader at IMC Trading before developing a strong interest in healthcare through my personal experiences.

We both pursued a BS/MS in Computer Science from Stanford and have collaborated on several AI and healthcare projects, including a mobile app for cancer patients with the Stanford Center of Biodesign.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90700&key=user_uploads/1833511/5c75bcc2-45d3-4189-a648-772afed8244d)

We’d love to hear from you; please reach out if you want to chat → [founders@galenai.com](mailto:founders@galenai.com). Thank you!

launches.title: Auctor: AI agents that streamline enterprise software implementations.
launches.body:
Hey YC! 👋

We're Xinan, Will, Matt, and Sky—co-founders of Auctor. We’re building an AI-native platform that streamlines enterprise software implementations.

**TL;DR:**\
Enterprise software implementations (Oracle, SAP, Salesforce, etc.) are messy and expensive, plagued by shifting requirements, misaligned teams, and obsolete documentation. Auctor's AI agents solve this by automatically capturing requirements, generating artifacts (like SoWs, proposals, architecture docs, user stories, and more), and seamlessly syncing everything across your tools, eliminating costly delays and change orders.

🎬 **Launch Video:** https://youtu.be/A-T2gwZCOMM

## **🚨 The Problem**

Every implementation team—whether at software vendors or tech consultancies—knows this pain:

* Fuzzy, incomplete requirements at kickoff
* Tribal knowledge buried in notes and scattered docs
* Endless manual edits across SOWs, user stories, test plans, and more
* Costly rework, misalignment, and change orders

Despite billions invested annually, over 70% of enterprise implementations still experience significant delays, overruns, and failures.

## **🚀 Our Solution**

After over 300 customer calls, we've spent the last several months building what we think every implementation team needs:\
🧠 AI agents that join your discovery/refinement calls,

✍️ capture every requirement,

📄 generate artifacts—from SOWs & design docs to user stories & configs,

🔁 and keep it all in sync every time something changes.

**It’s like having a sales engineer, solutions architect, and a delivery lead...all working 24/7, automatically.**

# 👫  **The Team**

We are four best friends who gave up our jobs at Meta, Google, AWS, and Apple, and dropped out of Johns Hopkins to tackle the broken implementation process head-on. 

We're building a new intelligence layer that leading mid-market and enterprise customers are leveraging today to reshape how implementations get done, faster than ever.

Oh—and meet our fifth cofounder (Chief Bark Officer 🐶) in the photo!

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90211&key=user_uploads/1780083/82da5007-0632-4ce8-9bad-43b68de9ee9b)

## **🙏 Our Ask**

* Know any professional services, customer success, or tech consulting leaders struggling with complex implementations? We'd love an intro 👉 [will@getauctor.com](mailto:xinan@getauctor.com)
* Curious how Auctor can transform your own implementations?[ Book a live demo here!](https://www.getauctor.com)

Thank you—more to come!

launches.title: Approval AI - Easiest Way To Get The Best Home Loan 🏡
launches.body:
Hey everyone, we’re [Arjun](https://www.linkedin.com/in/arjun-lalwani/) & [Helly](https://www.linkedin.com/in/hellyshah/), co-founders of Approval AI. 👋

**TL;DR**\
[Approval AI](https://www.getapproval.ai/) **is America’s first AI mortgage platform built to help homebuyers save time, money, and stress.** We automate the most painful parts of getting a mortgage: paperwork, rate shopping, and negotiation, all in one place.

https://youtu.be/bcmC6xe9nUA

# **🏦 The Mortgage Problem**

More than half of homebuyers don’t shop for a mortgage, even though it could save them a significant amount of money. Why? Because the process is so overwhelming:\
🧱 **High friction** \
Switching lenders is a hassle. Buyers have to upload the same documents to multiple portals, navigate different requirements, and jump on calls with each loan officer.

**💸 Lack of know-how** \
Most buyers don’t know they _can_ shop around or how to do it. Confusing terms like “points” and “relationship pricing” make it hard to know what’s actually a good deal. So buyers stick with the first lender out of convenience, not confidence. And switching later feels risky as it could delay or even derail the deal.

**☎️ Spam overload** \
Shopping for a mortgage often triggers a flood of unwanted calls and emails from lenders.

# **✨ The Approval AI Magic**

Approval AI reimagines how homebuyers get a mortgage. With one simple form, our AI assistant handles the entire process, so buyers get the best loan with less work.

https://youtu.be/PCUBgSjUvNw?si=qXIssoIa_zCaaWH3

**📄 One form. Every lender.** \
Like a “Common App” for mortgages, buyers complete one form and our AI handles the rest. It finds the best lenders for a buyer’s profile, shares the necessary details, and guides them seamlessly from pre-approval to closing.

📞 **AI-powered negotiation** \
Our AI assistant reaches out to banks, brokers, and credit unions to request quotes, negotiate rates, and compare offers, getting buyers the best deal with zero awkward calls.

🤖 \*\*Smart Guidance, Human Support.\*\*\
The AI assistant is available 24/7 to answer questions and explain mortgage terms in plain language. When more help is needed, human experts are just a message away.

**🚫 Zero spam**\
We protect buyers’ personal data and only share what’s necessary, keeping their inboxes free from lender spam.

# **👋 Our Ask**

🏡 Know someone buying a home? Send them to [**getapproval.ai**](http://getapproval.ai). It could help them save thousands.

💬 Know any real estate agents or lenders? We're also looking to connect with real estate agents and loan officers who would be open to sharing feedback. 📩 Connect us at [**hello@getapproval.ai**](mailto:arjun@getapproval.ai)

📲 Want to support? A follow or shoutout on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/approval-ai/) or [X](https://x.com/approval_ai) means the world.

Thanks so much for your support. It makes a big difference to us!

# 🤝 **The Team**

Approval AI was founded by ex-Google and first time homebuyers in different cities who bonded over how confusing, expensive, and frustrating getting a mortgage was.

[Arjun](https://www.linkedin.com/in/arjun-lalwani/) (CEO) — previously worked as a Product Manager at Google (APM '20), where he led high-impact consumer products. LLMs like ChatGPT are changing how people discover brands. Most companies have **zero visibility** into how often they’re mentioned, what queries they rank for, or which competitors are winning.

name: Claim Health
one_liner: The first AI revenue platform for post-acute healthcare
long_description:
Post-acute agencies lose up to 15% of revenue each year to denials, non-compliant documentation, and delayed payments. Most treat it as a cost of doing business. Instead of waiting weeks for rejections and appealing claims one by one, Claim Health flags issues in real-time and automates claim corrections and appeals—before revenue is lost.

While working with healthcare providers, we found most denials stem from small, preventable documentation errors. As payor requirements grow increasingly complex and fragmented, billing has become a manual, error-prone process. Claim Health closes the loop between documentation and billing outcomes—using AI to detect issues, automate workflows, and recover thousands in missed revenue each week.

Kevin and JJ bring nearly a decade of experience building and scaling healthtech companies. At Dandy, JJ was a founding engineer and Kevin was the first GTM hire; together they helped grow the business from 0 to $150M+ ARR. At Perry (now Jolly), JJ led engineering and Kevin was Head of Sales, driving the company through a $16.5M Series A led by Tesla’s former CFO.

In under three weeks since incorporation, we've launched with three agencies and are in early discussions with large U.S. health systems.

Post-acute care is a $400B market with over $20B in annual revenue leakage due to broken billing workflows. Claim Health is fixing that—starting with denials, and expanding into the full revenue cycle stack.

launches.title: Claim Health - AI revenue platform for at-home care providers
launches.body:
Hello world! We are [Kevin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kevincalcado/) and [JJ](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jayenram/) - co-founders of Claim Health, the first AI revenue platform for at-home care. Check out our demo [here](https://youtu.be/NBpZhDoU134):

**The Problem**

Healthcare billing teams are drowning in red tape with ever-changing insurance rules, very manual processes, and siloed data streams.

We counted 158 clicks to submit a single claim with one of our first customers!

![](https://media3.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExNW16bnJybDd0anpsY3luNG5kbGE4dzBwczJvZWhtZXFteWt0MjhrNyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/xUPGcoTKhfDvStjxMA/giphy.gif)

In our conversations with at-home care providers (think nursing homes, home health, home care, and hospice) providers, Kevin and I kept hearing that “getting money in the door” was the single thing preventing agencies from growing. \
\
Many home health and home care agencies have to literally say no to patients who need care.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90010&key=user_uploads/545198/3bc40a31-3185-46a7-8fa1-0a4818da0ed3)

**What Claim Health is doing about it**

We want medical billing to be a **one-click** process. Billers should spend their time making the important decisions and triaging involved in the revenue cycle process.

Our platform surfaces the claims that need attention and automates the submission of the one’s that are routine. In addition, we manage denials by helping billers generate appeal letters and are implementing voice agents to request information enrichment from insurance companies.

Our initial product has been rolled out to early customers and has already

1. turned a 3 day a week billing process to a 2 hour process
2. found 6 figures in lost revenue from denials and underpayments.

Check us out at [**claimhealth.ai**](http://claimhealth.ai)

**Know a at-home care agency looking to supercharge their revenue operations?** Connect us → [kevin@claimhealth.ai](https://mailto:kevin@claimhealth.ai) / [Book a demo](https://calendly.com/kevin-claimhealth/30min)

— JJ & Kevin

launches.title: Almond - AI-powered robots for manufacturing automation
launches.body:
Hey there 👋

We’re [Saba](https://www.linkedin.com/in/saba-khalilnaji/) and [Shawn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shawnpatel/), the founders of [Almond](https://almondbot.com/). We’re on a mission to accelerate manufacturing automation with AI-powered robots.

**TL;DR**

We’re launching [Almond Bot](https://almondbot.com/bot), a vision-first cobot that ships with the cameras, compute and AI needed to automate vision-based tasks like product inspections and bin picking.

**You can **[**buy**](https://almondbot.com/bot)** Almond Bot today for $7,999.**

Check out our launch video below 👇

<https://youtu.be/GnelBnYut84>

**The Problem**

Integrating a robotic solution into a factory costs \~10x more than the robot itself and takes 90% of the time. The cost is high because robots today rely on precise hardware and fixtures to move from A to B repeatedly. On top of that, programming the robots to account for variations is challenging. For example, if you’re loading a metal block into a CNC machine, and the block isn’t in the exact spot the robot expected it to be, the robot, the block or the CNC could get damaged. Vision systems help but it makes the software even more challenging. How do you tell the robot to pick up the block from an image? There's so much more we can automate in the world today, but it's just too expensive to implement.

**The Solution** 

AI lets robots learn from examples. Almond Bot combines a robot, a vision system and AI-ready compute with well-documented APIs to make teaching and programming take minutes instead of days.

![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXdIb1v5w1Ybemq8pNaDyiJ6JKgj4SieFFRxqe0gub5yxzD_9LzrkDc4oWr3NZDn6R7FMAltEmx3Fm26EyUmVc0DT-9sEVdWaiVCx73VrP2Npz2S8us1rUTzvXTJ0UhZD5ZaCW7R?key=H_Wx00jovKE-xyZ1tNmS1PhD)

With Almond Bot, you can:

✅ Train and run custom object detection models with 2-clicks. Watch Almond Bot automatically collect image samples to train a model on a build plate handle.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90035&key=user_uploads/33058/ae4e469b-3170-4b50-b287-a489e170e25e)

✅ Train and run a VLA model from our dashboard. Use the Almond Bot joystick to collect your data in just an hour.

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90035&key=user_uploads/33058/4a0705d7-6850-4394-b15f-b60d85a4c9c3)

✅ Detect and align with AprilTags

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90035&key=user_uploads/33058/38b9c6f9-cc7e-4720-8653-1b4c0ce3cccc)

You can [buy](https://almondbot.com/bot) Almond Bot today for $7,999 and start programming on day one.

**Almond Bot Specs**

* A standard cobot arm with 5kg payload, 922mm reach, and 0.02mm repeatability
* An adaptive 2-finger gripper with 2kg payload, 105N force and 145mm stroke
* Stereoscopic cameras for 3D perception
* NVIDIA Jetson for compute
* An unpowered mobile base with locking casters for easy mobility
* A simple, [well-documented API](https://docs.almondbot.com/get_started/introduction)
* A mini control joystick for intuitive teleoperation and data collection
* Community Slack support channel

**The Team**

* Shawn is an ex-Google hardware engineer who previously led electronics on UC Berkeley’s formula team.
* Saba is an ex-DoorDash and Conduit engineer who learned that labor is the core challenge to solve.  

**Our Ask**

* If you need to automate a task, try Almond Bot.
* If you know a factory or warehouse in need of automation, please email us at [founders@almondbot.com](mailto:founders@almondbot.com).

launches.title: Chonkie 🦛 Open Source Data Ingestion for AI
launches.body:
![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90330&key=user_uploads/1849274/669a375f-f24a-4d4b-9cca-c668ce5d3da4)

## 🚀 TL;DR

Models are now a commodity. The real differentiator for AI applications is _how effectively they use their data_. However, building robust data systems can be both complex and time-consuming.

Chonkie fixes this. We make it easy to bring high-quality data ingestion and context-building to your AI projects, ensuring your application is accurate, fast, and cost-efficient.

We’re open source on GitHub! ([Python](https://github.com/chonkie-inc/chonkie), [TypeScript](https://github.com/chonkie-inc/chonkie-ts)). Leave us a ⭐!

# 🎬 Launch Video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eBvCCEgbNDw

---

---

---

---

---

---

---

---

## 👀 Are you…

👷 **A Builder**

* Install with [pip install chonkie ](https://pypi.org/project/chonkie/)or [npm i chonkie](https://www.npmjs.com/package/chonkie)
* Use it for free in your projects
* Join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/6V5pqvqsCY) for direct support from the founders!

🏢 **Business Looking To Go AI Native**

* Want a managed ingestion pipeline? [Contact us](https://cal.com/shreyashn/chonkie-demo)
* Enjoy a white-glove onboarding experience
* Use our hosted solution or deploy on-prem!

## ✨ Why Chonkie?

Most AI products today don’t fail because of the model. They fail because they’re fed disorganized, bloated, or incomplete data. The results in wrong answers, slow performance, and expensive bills. There are some existing tools that try to address this, however they are either:

* 🔻 Too slow or bloated
* 🧱 Too barebones — feels like reinventing the wheel every time

So we built **Chonkie** — fast, lightweight, and comprehensive.

**Chonkie + Your Amazing AI Application =**

* 🎯 More accurate result
* ⚡ Faster response times
* 💸 Lower token usage

## 🔧 What Can Chonkie Do?

Chonkie handles the full data ingestion pipeline for AI projects:

* 📄**Bring Any Document**: All formats welcome
* 🍳**Clean It with Our Chefs**: Normalize and prep your data
* 🧩**Chunk It**: Break documents into meaningful pieces
* 🛠️**Refine Your Chunks:** Add context, metadata, or convert to embeddings
* 🔌**Connect Anywhere**: Integrate with any database and fetch your chunks with ease

## 🎥 See It in Action

See how Chonkie splits your data, reduces token costs by over **75%**, and generates citations automatically!

![uploaded image](/media/?type=post&id=90330&key=user_uploads/1849274/5ec9dbe7-37c8-428d-b589-8d71c6195191)

## ✅ Try Chonkie Today

* 📬Looking for a managed enterprise solution? [Contact us](https://cal.com/shreyashn/chonkie-demo)
* 💻 Install our open source offering with  pip install chonkie or npm i chonkie
* 💬Join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/6V5pqvqsCY) for support and community

\~Happy Chonking! 🦛✨

name: HelixDB
one_liner: A graph-vector database for building RAG and AI.
long_description:
HelixDB is a graph-vector database that brings structure to vector data, enabling developers to easily build Graph/Hybrid RAG applications. While vector databases have become essential for AI, they fall short when retrieval requires explicit properties or relationships. Existing solutions either bolt vector functionality onto legacy graph databases with poor performance, or force developers to integrate separate systems through middleware, creating overhead and latency bottlenecks.

Built from scratch in Rust, HelixDB leverages world-class expertise in low-level systems programming and algorithms to achieve extreme performance optimizations impossible with existing architectures. This deep technical approach stands in contrast to the LLM-dependent development prevalent in the industry, requiring specialized knowledge in areas where AI tools currently fall short.

The timing is optimal: graph databases are finally gaining recognition after two decades of underutilization, while vector databases have proven their AI value but revealed structural limitations. We emerge as the market awakens to hybrid solutions, positioned early enough to capture the opportunity but not so early as to lack ready adopters.
